result.execSummary:
The defendant Taylor S Lange was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Taylor S Lange is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Taylor S Lange was found guilty of Injury by Intoxicated Use/Vehicle, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.25(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
2:20 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites offer - defendant will plea to the charge with probation.  ADA concurs.  Atty Selsing concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Defendant will waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Selsing and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Selsing enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1 and strikes the repeater and dismisses outright count 2.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  ADA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by ADA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Selsing.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 3 years.

CONDITIONS:

-8 months county jail, to start within 30 days. Court grants huber and out of county service and out of county travel.
-DL revocation - 2 years
-Restitution - $58.48
-Court costs
-AODA & follow-up
-DNA Sample
-Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Court adjourned at 2:33 p.m.
Summary of Restitution and Costs w/attachments - $58.48
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-15-2016 02:00 pm

11:33 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - have received an offer and have accepted and requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  Court sets for Plea & Sentencing on March 15, 2016 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 11:34 a.m.
Status hearing at 02-09-2016 11:30 am

11:05 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty John Selsing.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Selsing - would like time to discuss with the DA.  Court sets for Status Hearing on February 9, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 11:06 a.m.
Status hearing at 01-12-2016 10:00 am
By Atty John Selsing
Status hearing at 01-11-2016 09:30 am

8:46 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 11, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:50 a.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Initial appearance at 12-15-2015 08:30 am
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:13 p.m.  Defendant present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the complaint.  Court goes over penalties and as repeater.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  Court orders bond of $1,000.00 signature bond and conditions of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Defendant to return to court on December 15, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:16 p.m.
